description.p: This program will create and edit control networks.
To run qnet, you will need to create a text file containing a list of all cubes in the control network.

The main window of qnet is similar to the program "qview". You will see many of the same tools such as zoom, pan, stretch, etc. The Tie tool will be the default tool selected (the bottom button along the right hand toolbar) when qnet is launched.

Once qnet is up, select the "Open network" button or the open action (from File menu), and open the file containing the list of cubes in the network. You will then be prompted for the control network file. If you are editing an existing one, choose that file. If you are creating a new control network, choose the "Cancel" button.

The Control Network Navigator allows you to filter cubes or points on different attributes. If filtering cubes, you can then view the cube(s) chosen from the filtered list. If filtering points, you can view the cube(s) for the chosen points from the list or edit a chosen point.

Cubes are displayed in the main window, with control points displayed as green "+", yellow "+" (points set to "Ignored") or red "+" (point currently being edited). When the Tie tool is the chosen tool, the mouse buttons have the following function in the cube viewports of the main qnet window:
description.pre: Left Button: Modify the closest control point Middle Button: Delete the closest control point Right Button: Create new control point
description.p: If modifying or creating a point, the Point Editor dialog will be displayed, which will display the cube that is the "Reference" cube on the left and the next cube in the control point on the right. Only the control measure on the right hand side can be moved. The measure can be adjusted by:
description.pre:
1) clicking the left mouse button will move that cursor position under the crosshair 2) move 1 pixel at a time using arrow keys on the keyboard 3) move 1 pixel at a time using arrow buttons on the Point Editor dialog
Other Point Editor functions / options:
Geom: Geom the right view to match the left view
Rotate: Rotate the right view
Blink controls (buttons below left view): Blink the left and right view in the left view window. Using the arrow keys to move the right view will update the blinking in real time.
Find: Center the right view so that the same latitude / longitude is under the crosshair as the left view.
Register: Sub-pixel register the the right view to the left view.
Save Point: Save the control measure under the right view in the control network.
Add Measure(s) to Point: Add control measure(s) to the current control point.
